lines.text: Why don't you come up some time and see me?
Listen, when women go wrong, men go right after them.
Haven't you ever met a man that could make you happy?
Sure, lots of times.
Well, surely you don't mind my holding your hand?
It ain't heavy - I can hold it myself.
You know, ever since I sang that song it's been haunting me.
You murdered it.
Yes, I wasn't always rich.
No?
No, there was a time I didn't know where my next husband was coming from.
Ah, Lady Lou, you're a fine gal, a fine woman.
One of the finest women ever walked the streets.
I swear I shall make you happy. I shall die to make you happy.
Mmm, but you wouldn't be much use to me dead.
A little bit spicy, but not too raw, you know what I mean?
Come up again - any time.
I shall, then I hope you will be alone.
So do I, warm, dark and handsome.
I am delighted. I have heard so much about you.
Yeah, but you can't prove it.
[Lady Lou shares the latest photographs of herself]
They are wonderful but, uh, I like best that marvelous painting of you in the bar.
Oh, yeah, I gotta admit that is a flash, but I do wish Gus hadn't hung it up over the free lunch.
Say, Lou, you fallin' for that bloke?
Oh, it ain't nothin' serious, but there was somethin' just wonderful about him.

[handing over a diamond necklace]
Here's your twelve thousand.
How do I know it is?
Because I say so. You never heard of me cheatin' anyone, did ya?
No, no. Not about money.
I'm sorry you think more of your diamonds than you do of your soul.
I'm sorry you think more of my soul than you do of my diamonds.
[Captain Cummings approaches Lou with a pair of handcuffs]
Those absolutely necessary? You know I wasn't born with them.
No. A lot of men would've been safer if you had.
Oh, I don't know - hands ain't everything.
You bad girl.
Mmm, you find out.
Well I... I gotta be getting back to the mission. Sally's father is waiting for me.
Hmm, that oughta be interesting.
What would you do if somebody tried to take her from you?
Probably nut'n' - to HER.

[in prison]
Say, Lou, how 'bout give me another chance when I get out.
When do you get out?
Fifteen years.
That's a date.
Guess I'm taking your time.
Wadda you suppose m' time's for?
The men in my country go wild about women with yellow hair.
I'm glad you told me. I wanna keep straight on my geography.
So you met a man who wouldn't fall for you, eh?
Who wants him to fall? Why he'd be the kind the woman'd have to marry to get rid of.
I wouldn't want no policeman to catch me without no petticoat.
No policeman? How about a nice fireman?
Your bath is ready Miss Lou.
You take it, I'm indisposed.
I shall die to make you happy.
But you wouldn't be much use to me dead.

[to Captain Cummings]
You can be had.
Diamonds is my career.
You know, it was a toss up whether I go in for diamonds or sing in the choir. The choir lost.
That's it. Loosen up. Unbend. You'll fell better.
To get you, I'd even frame my own mother.
